The stand outs are anything Kung Pao, even the tofu one is awesome.  I also enjoy the curry chicken/beef.  They also have $1 hot and sour soup for dining in and it hits the spot when its cold and ugly outside.  The front desk guy is awesome too, he knows my hubby and I by name and always greets us accordingly.  This is the one place I crave on the weekends and no one in the East Bay even begins to compete.  Oh and don't miss the awesome fried rice here, not greasy with veggies you actually recognize.  Me love you a long long time, yep had to go there!
author: La C.

description: Was introduced to this place by an acquaintance recently. The guys at work all went  today and we enjoyed it. We got there 11:40 and got seated right away. Large portions, reasonable lunch specials. Try the appetizer "Diana's meat pie" its like a chinese tostada.
author: Ryan D.

description: I walked into this restaurant because it has the Zagat Rated sign at the door. I am extremely disappointed because the food is not authetic at all. Too saulty is the problem. But they do give you a big portion in case you are very hungry.
author: Iwen C.

description: I'm always happy when I grab Henry's for take-out on my way home from work.  There's not a lot of Chinese food options in the neighborhood, and I can count on Henry's when I need that fix of quick, spicy, tasty food that goes perfectly with rice and fills you up.
author: Leo C.

description: Ok, so this is a pretty decent lunch spot.  Surprisingly large.  Surprisingly busy.  Surprisingly tasty,,,kinda.  I had the rock cod and tasted some of the orange chicken.  Both were good...maybe not that memorable or that fabulous...but good enough...for lunch.  The menu is huge, overwhelming a bit.  And there were at least 10 things I wanted to try.  So, looks like I'll be back.  For lunch.  Just for lunch.
author: Susan L.

description: If these reviews do anything, may they please get a business to acknowledge a problem and fix it. Anyone see the consistency? Let me help, everyone is saying the service is slow. Its always slow when I am there and after reading all these reviews it looks like thats everyday. Getting a table, making an order, and getting your check, it all ruined my suprisingly good food. Customer service! You have good food and then you blow it with your service? The good news in the restaurant world is bad service is fixable, so I suggest you fix it, and fast.
author: Michael G.

description: I wish I lived near one of the Henry Hunan restaurants. I'm not sure how they're affiliated but each of the locations has the dishes I like, the spicy rod cod and the spicy string beans. This location does the rock cod slightly better than the others but they're all good! Lunch time is a fiasco so if you're going to eat there, go early. Back in the day, Henry's was THE place for Chinese in the city. Not sure what happened but seems like they've lost some of their luster. Too bad, but more for me. Just to be clear, you're not going for the decor but the food is good.
author: Richard S.

description: I'm a fan of the Hunan style of Chinese cuisine, mainly because I am a guy who enjoys spicy food (I put hot sauce on just about everything). The best time to try this place would be during the afternoon, when the lunch specials are still in effect. The dishes are a little more expensive than I would like, so I only come here a few times a year, maybe. Everything I've tried here has been great. If you're gonna get an appitizer, I reccomend their Green Onion Pancakes, or if you're a carnivore, the postickers (dumplings) here are top-notch (I remember from back when I ate meat). If you work in the financial district, don't bother coming here unless you've got a full lunch hour, because it can be quite crowded on the weekdays.
author: Sean R.

description: Ok, this restaurant had great flavor and some of the WORST service I ever had! We 8 people for lunch at one table, noone took our order until we were there 15 minutes, then 2 appetizers came out, followed by 3 meals and then nothing for 20 minutes until we asked, then it was another 10 minutes to get our food; obviously the first group was already done, not being rude, just wanting to eat hot food. Tasty, but BAD service, NEVER go there in a hurry at lunch.
author: Maryellen O.

description: This is the only Chinese restaurant in the Fidi I will eat it.  It's not a five-star Sunset/Richmond Chinese place, but it's pretty good.  The menu is a bit lacking for me, but I always enjoy what i order.  Word of advice, if you are limited to an hour, wait til 1pm.
author: angela k.

description:
Have been to this place twice now - first at an office party (i.e accidentally) and second time with family (i.e purposely). And must say, I have enjoyed it thoroughly each time. Doesn't burn a hole in the pocket either.

I have grown up eating Chinese the way they do it at Hunan's so my joy knew no bounds when I discovered this place. The spicy Chinese - yumm....

Most dishes are good, with an exceptional bland one. To give my take on few dishes that I recall:
Diana's meat pie - ok ok, dont think its authentic Chinese
Kung Pao Chicken - Spicy heaven
Sliced Beef with Bell peppers - perfectly cooked beef
Hunan Style Sweet and Sour Pork or Chicken - tad too sweet
Marty's Special - Good, but I wud have liked it spicier
Combo Fried rice - good accompaniment to other dishes.

So these are the few things I recall. Definitely plan to drop by again!!!
author: Prachi S.

description: Beware they place hot food in #1 PET plastic clamshell take out containers made for cold food.  Yummy toxins melting into your broccoli beef.  ask them not to package in this  #1 plastic.  Should be 2, 4, 5 or better yet paper take out boxes.
author: Big B.

description: I've been here several times for lunch.  I've pretty much liked everything that I've had, although they do seem to use the same bean sauce for almost every dish.   Most dishes seem to be a bit spicey, but I like some kick to my meals.  The portions are huge, so you won't be leaving on an empty stomach.  I like the smoked ham and bean sauce the best.
author: Ed B.

description: Favorite Chinese downtown. Great place to meet  friends as there is lots of tables in a big space. There truly is something for everyone to eat and be happy with on the menu.
author: Kat S.

description:
Here is why I won't be eating at Henry's anymore.
I have been eating at Henrys for probably 7+ years.
Loved the spicy. Loved the dishes.
Hate being ripped off! 
Hate spending $15.00 for the Scallops or the Hunan Special and getting a container only 3/4 full. 
Used to be full every time.
Hate that my food has not been washed, and I end up chewing sand.
Hate that when I called to tell them, I got some lame excuse.
I didn't call to get a lame excuse. I did not call to argue.
I called because I liked the food, but over the last couple years I have seen the quality decline, and I thought someone should know so they could correct the problem and I could continue eating there.
Did anyone take my name or number?
Did anyone thank me for the feedback?
Could anyone just listen, and not try to argue?
No.
So, Henry's Hunan, When you see your business decline, take this letter to heart.
I don't mind spending for quality, and I hate spending for sub-par.
CLEAN YOUR FOOD!
FILL YOUR CONTAINERS FULL!
Not too much to ask is it?
author: Brent T.

description:
Went for lunch with co-workers, is very crowded but has fast churn, so we got a table relatively fast.

The beef with tofu was good, and was nice and spicy (if you don't like spicy, ask for your dish to be mild..or it will end up spicy).
author: Aditya P.

description:
if you are going out of your way to come here... don't bother. if you are in the area and want chinese food. then this is the place you go. 

greasy chinese food. decent chinese service.
author: stephanie w.

description: There's a reason why there's always a line of people at Henry's after 12pm. You'd better get there before the "rush" else you may face a bit of a wait for your food. But otherwise, the food is great. I used to get Henry's takeout all the time for dinner when I worked downtown and I try to get down there every time I work in San Francisco.
author: Alex B.

description:
One of the best food i have eaten, good Egg plant dish and also great string beans.

The lunch specials are good and really cheap for downtown prices.. :)
author: Sandeep K.

description:
I love Henry's.  Well prepared dishes.  And spicy-hot too!!  I'm addicted.

I've had about 15 of the dishes so far, all of them very good.  

My favorite spicy-hot dish is the Polish Sausage, Hunan Style - I know it sounds weird, but its a really great dish that you gotta try (I especially like the chunks of fresh green peppers).  The smoked ham dishes are also great.

My favorite spicy but not hot dish is Henry's Shredded Pork (its not spicy-hot even though it is on the spicy-hot side of the menu)..

Make sure to order rice with your meal - I think the dishes are designed to be eaten with rice.
author: Gary S.

description:
Foul food.  I ordered the country style vegetableS.  Did you notice that last letter on that last word?  It was an "S" which is how words are PLURALIZED in English.

When a word is pluralized, that means that there are more than one of them.  My beige greasy dish arrived to the table as one gelatinously congealed lump.  It was difficult to tell where the fried tofu ended and where the fried glass noodles ended or where the fried cabbage began.  

Hints of green were available amidst the interminable shards of cabbage, but they proved curiously elusive to efforts to snatch them with the chopsticks, as they fell apart upon touch.

Vegetables means more than one vegetable.  Friends rave about this place, but after waiting like 40 min to get seated at 1:15 PM, could no longer stand it and paid the check and left.
author: M S.

description: please do not come here if you don't have to.  one of my co-workers raved about henry's and decided to treat me for lunch.  the food here tastes the same (i tried a bit of his dish), and it's oily.   the ambiance and taste makes me think that i'm in a little rural town in texas, catering food to the uncultured folks who think this is the real deal.  on a more positive note, service is good and the place is clean. oh, and my co-worker paid for my meal.
author: Amy Z.

description: I live for their meat pies!!!!! AAAAAWESOOOOME!!!!! They are on the pricey side but it is definitely worth the sacrifice. I've also tried their dumplings and sweet & sour pork. The dumplings were ok just like potstickers, but the ss pork was even better. I highly recommend trying this place at least once. I wish I could have meat pies for dinner every night! Yumm!
author: Elle E.

description: This place has changed. The cook has changed. The food is not what it use to be  never going back again. I guess they don't understand when you order extra gravy extra meat easy on the veggies. They do the opposite.
author: Henry P.

description: i give it to them that they were pretty nice considering they close at 9, and a large group walked in at 845.  they wanted all orders to be taken by 9 pm.  service was fast, and the food arrived quickly.  however, i thought everything basically tasted the same.
author: Helen T.

description: This is one of my favorite Chinese places.  While i live on the peninsula, I make it a point to stop by when I'm in the City.  This is the best of their locations.  Their dumplings are incredible and I love the Kung Pao Chicken.  I wish they'd get a location near me.
author: R. M.

description: I live next door to Henry's on Natoma and it is my favorite take-out/delivery restaurant. If we have guests in from out of town for more than one night, Henry's is always part of our itinerary. We have converted many disciples from multiple cities & states. There are a few old standbys - Harvest Pork (well done), Black Bean Chicken, Combo Chow Mein, Dumplings, delicious Hot & Sour Soup, etc. The team working the phone and delivering our dinner is friendly, courteous and defies all explanation by how little time lapses between the instant I hang up the phone and the moment my doorbell rings.
author: John B.

description: 3 stars for the meat pie.  Greasy deliciousness and the world's best hangover cure.
author: Michele M.

description: I gave them two stars only because I didn't get food poisoning.  Both times that I ordered from them, thier dishes were not good and unbearably salty.  Do not go...unless you like really salty chinese food.
author: Elisa W.

description: So what I should have done was listen to most of the overwhelmingly bad reviews for this restaurant here in the yelp community, but I decided to be bold and go for it. Ugh, what a mistake that turned out to be. First, like most people, I had to wait FOREVER in that relatively cramped entrance way because I was smart enough not to call in ahead and place my order. But that was no big deal, I was on my lunch hour. So anyway, I decided to order the chicken fried rice (which by the way was the best part of the meal, and the only way I am able to compose this review....or I would have starved trying). I also ordered the sauteed eggplant. This was absolutely horrible. The sogginess factor is not the worst part (as I have read in other reviews) it's the indescribable flavor that accompanies this mess. I like to be as spontaneous as the next person, but this was terrible. I kept wondering, what the hell is IN this? On the walk back to the office was when I knew it was all downhill. I kept smelling something "really gross" only to discover it was in the very bag that contained what was supposed to have been my lunch. My last dish was the orange chicken. OK, I get it....ORANGE chicken. But seriously, it was so overpowered by orange rinds that all I could really taste WAS the orange. Also, it was really REALLY sweet, which I don't like. My biggest complaint is that I ruined my rice by pouring the eggplant and orange chicken over it. How terrible an establishment must be when the only thing worth mentioning is the rice. I guess if you want to be brave like I was and try this place out for yourself, the only thing I can tell you is to steer clear from the orange chicken and the eggplant. You will be sorry if you don't! I would suggest B&M's eggplant chicken (without the chicken) down the street really. But as for me, I think I will stick to sushi from now on when I need my "asian" infused fix. Much healthier and at least I KNOW what I'm eating. Good luck....
author: Tiauna G.

description: I was completely disappointed after my co-workers raved about this dump.  I ordered the lunch special 'curry chix'. (mild).  It was actually super spicy-hot.  The sauce drenched the rice so I had nothing to dilute the sauce with.  Aside from being hot, the flavor was dull and uninspiring. The waitress asked me how I liked it.  I told her I didn't like it at all.  She looked at me and giggled and I am not surprised that she didn't offer something else.  This place is no better than a hole in the wall in Chinatown.         I'm glad I have peanuts at my desk.
author: joy j.

description: Mediocre food, though favoured by many I know.  If you want really salty, heavily seasoned, muscular, unsubtle food, sure.  However, I'm not sure if I'd really go out of my way for this food.
author: Anonymous M.

description: tasy chinese food, good hot & sour soup and spicy green beans.  i think there might be some msg in there but for the most part their food is filling and tasty, albeit a bit greasy.  usually very speedy and a big place, though lacking in decor.
author: Suzanne V.

description: Every time I go to the MOMA around mealtime I try stop at Henry's. My favorite thing is Diana's Special Delicious Meat Pie which is both special and delicious. It's HUGE so definitley plan on splitting it. The flaky crusts don't travel well, either, so not a good dish to try to take home and eat later. The other thing I LOVE here is the spicy cucumber noodle dish that's available only at lunchtime (BOO!) that has chicken or some other meat in it (I can't remember it's been so long since I made it there at lunchtime!) with a peanut sauce. Yum! It's also a cheaper option than the good but very $$ restaurant at the MOMA.
author: Alexis D.

description: i love this place! the food is great! you can have the dish with any degree of spiciness. The dishes come out fast. I love eating the Henry's Special (seafood), Curry Chicken, Meat Pie, Dumplings and Rock Cod Fillet. So delicious, I think I am about to drool a little just thinking about it. its a great family restaurant and great for large parties.
author: Amy C.
